alert.note: Alert for Central Panhandle Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 09 at 6:45PM MST until January 10 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST WEDNESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations between 4 and 8 inches in the mountains and up to 2 inches in the valleys. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 8 and 18 inches possible. * WHERE...Osburn, Pinehurst, Kellogg, Wallace, Lookout Pass, St. Maries, Fourth Of July Pass, Mullan, Dobson Pass, and Fernwood. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 10 AM PST Wednesday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late Wednesday night through Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday evening and Wednesday morning commutes. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...For Thursday and Friday, an Arctic front tracking into North Idaho Thursday night and Friday will bring gusty northeast winds with areas of blowing and drifting snow and much colder temperatures.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road information in Idaho, call 5 1 1. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
